poem:
Title: The Searing Scribble

In snug corners of indigo,
Resides a tale in script of gold.
Looms the loom, the weaver's woe,
Pieces of an empire old.

Spindled silk, threads of yore,
Speak a language not yet trite.
Yet, in whispers along the shore,
Lament the right to write.  

Deftly spun, the poet's trade,
In searing linen, finds its grace.
Couched in parchment, truth is laid,
A single sonnet in vast space.
